Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Vessel with Two Handles of King Djoser
Description: The vessel is a kind of jar with a short neck, a turned rim and two handles that unites the rim to the oval body. It was used to keep food and drinks to consume after death. This kind of stone vessel appeared in Egypt during the predynastic period about 3500 BC. Before this date, the vessels were made of clay, specially in Merimda in Lower Egypt. The Egyptian artist had fabricated these vessels without using the potter wheel, only with his hands.
